description:
THOUSANDS OF YEARS AGO, before the dawn of man as we knew him,
there was Sir Santa of Claus, an ape-like creature making crude and
pointless toys out of dinobones and his own waste, hurling them at
chimp-like creatures with crinkled hands regardless of how they
behaved the previous year.  These so-called "toys" were buried as
witches, and defecated upon, and hurled at predators when wakened by
the searing grunts of children.  It wasn't a holly jolly Christmas
that year.  For many were killed.  A war-like race of elves from the
Red Planet landed on the ice-encased Earth, and they were immediately
enslaved by the unevolved Santa Ape to make his confused toys using
galactic elfin technology.  Toys were made into recognizable shapes
and given names like "train," but these toys were also thrown at
predators and defecated upon because they were so stupid.  Christmas
still sucked, in a big way.

Meatwad: Boy, this IS a long story. Maybe I WILL get something to eat.

Carl: Yeah, I think I'm gonna get drunk while I listen.

Frylock: So, about this blood...

Robot: Let's just wait for them. ...So you been in the neighborhood long, or...

Frylock: Well, I mean we moved here, next to Carl--

Robot: THOUSANDS OF YEARS AGO the ice had made the globe invariable.
Santa Ape did not know where the North Pole was. How could he? He was
born before science existed. So he arbitrarily placed his workshop
RIGHT HERE, long before they unionized, and Christmas was celebrated
at each full Moon in front of a great red ape--

description:
{C
Runpurger is a mob holding rather complicated mprogs related to the systematic
opening, closing and resetting of Waterdeep's adventure run areas.  The basic
premise of the mprogs is as follows:
{W
Mprog Sequence Starts (MUD Crashes/reboots or runpurger is loaded up)
  1. Countdown mprog does initial check
     - closes all runs
  2. Countdown mprog cycles through base 32 checks
     One run is selected to be opened
     Run is open at next check
  3. Countdown mprog resets/recycles another base 32 checks
     Another run is selected to be opened, regardless if previous runs are done.
  4. Countdown cycles through the opening of every run
     The system resets itself by closing all runs and restarting the countdown.
{C
It is quite common for the mprogs to get "stuck" whereby it no longer counts
down.  This is evident by the lack of any new "run counter" items in runpurger's
inventory (the same items will remain there for a long period of time).  Consult
posted instructions for information on kickstarting the system or utilizing any
of the other features (opening of individual runs, purging of all runs, stopping
any single run from opening).
{x
Dugmaren, 2007{x
2995.name: runpurger~

3001.room_name: The baker works here calmly, wiping flour from his face with one hand.
description:
A fat, nice looking baker. But you can see that he has many scars on his
body.
3001.name: the baker~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3002.room_name: A prophet stands telling the people of a forsaken future.
description:
{^The Prophet tells you {5'I had a vision last night, i saw the
four swords of Ragnarok, the Element Swords. First i saw
a vision of William, holding a flaming sword. The Second
vision I saw was Veiros, carring the sword of the wind.
The Third vision was of a pixie by the name of Sandra,
carring the Sword Of Water. These swords when put together
in the Temple Of Light, will create a powerful blast of
energy, destroying Ragnarok...But the fourth sword is a
mystery to me...When i had a vision of this sword, I was
in total darkness, and a voice gave me a weird riddle...
"Where the sun never shines, where humans never go, a place
of total darkness, and dark creatures, is where the sword
of the Earth lies, guarded by your nightmares." I do not
know what this means, do you?'{x
3002.name: the prophet~
subroutines:
M give 3062 peanut brittle~
M speech 3061 here to help~
M grall 3014 100~

3003.room_name: Gord stands here with a smile, ready to make a sale.
description: Gord is a young weaponsmith, who still has lots to learn.
3003.name: the weaponsmith~

description:
An old but very strong armourer, he has made more armours in his
lifetime than you have ever seen.
3004.name: the armourer~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3005.room_name: A small crawly bug is here
description: A {GEVIL{x timber eatting bug crawls here{x
3005.name: A bug~

3006.room_name: A retired captain stands here, selling boats.
description: This captain has killed more sharks than you have eaten peas.
3006.name: the captain~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3007.room_name: Sergeant Pain is here, screaming out orders.
description: He looks like a strong, army type of guy.
3007.name: the sergeant~

3008.room_name: A pet shop boy is here, humming gently.
description: He is young and close-cropped and looks quite happy.
3008.name: the pet shop boy~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3009.room_name: The jeweller is standing behind the desk.
description: He is fat and has a content although watchful look on his face.
3009.name: the jeweller~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3010.room_name: The leather worker is sitting by the table, sewing a leather cap.
description:
She looks as an honest, hard-working artisan who only just earns enough to
keep herself going.
3010.name: the leather worker~
subroutines: M speech 30 your pay please~

3011.room_name: Sting is here, looking for Hollywood Hogan.
description:
I mean, what can you say about Sting.....Its STING.
You know, Tall, wears a Leather Trench Coat,
Looks like the Crow. Appears in Wcw in wierd
ways. But I wouldn't want to fight him.
3011.name: Sting~

3012.room_name: Joram The Great is here, selling spells.
description:
After all the years of doing good and helping,
the gods have blessed Joram with immortality,
in return that he helps out other adventurers
that he was once in his life.
Type 'heal' to see a listing of spells.
3012.name: Joram, the healer~

3014.room_name: The Law Enforcer Tester stands here testing.
3014.name: The Law Enforcer Tester~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

3361.room_name: A {RT{rri{RP{rower{x Building Contractor stands here, taking measurements.
3361.name: A Building Contractor~

description:
Even though your guildmaster looks old and tired, you can clearly see the
vast amount of knowledge she possesses. She is wearing fine magic clothing,
and you notice that she is surrounded by a blue shimmering aura.
3020.name: the guildmaster~

description:
You are in no doubt that this guildmaster is truly close to your god; he has
a peaceful, loving look. You notice that he is surrounded by a white aura.
3021.name: the guildmaster~

description:
You realize that whenever your guildmaster moves, you fail to notice it:
the way of the true thief.  She is dressed in poor clothing, having
the appearance of a beggar.
3022.name: the guildmaster~

description:
This is your master. A short, strong dwarf with bulging muscles.  Several scars
across his body prove that he was using arms before you were born.  He
has a calm look on his face.
3023.name: the guildmaster~

3024.room_name: A sorcerer is guarding the entrance.
description:
He is an experienced mage who has specialized in the field of Combat Magic.
He is here to guard the Mage's Guild and his superior knowledge of offensive
as well as defensive spells make him a deadly opponent.
3024.name: the sorcerer~

3025.room_name: A knight templar is guarding the entrance.
description:
He is a specially trained warrior belonging to the military order of the Faith.
His duty is to protect the faithful from persecution and infidel attacks and
his religious devotion combined with his superior skill makes him a deadly
opponent.
3025.name: the knight templar~

3026.room_name: An assassin is guarding the entrance.
description:
He is a thief who has specialized in killing others as effectively as possible,
using all sorts of weapons.  His superior knowledge of how and where to use
them combined with his extraordinary stealth makes him a deadly opponent.
3026.name: the assassin~

3027.room_name: A knight is guarding the entrance.
description:
He is an expert warrior who has attained knighthood through countless
chivalrous deeds.  His duty is to protect the Guild of Swordsmen and his
extreme skill combined with his experience in warfare makes him a deadly
opponent.
3027.name: the knight~

3028.room_name: A woodsman is guarding the entrance.
description:
He is an expert woodsman dressed in buckskins.  His duty is to protect
the Guild of Rangers and his extreme skill along with his very sharp spear
make him a deadly opponent.
3028.name: the woodsman~

3029.room_name: A dryad is guarding the entrance.
description:
She is an experienced druid who has specialized in the field of Magic.
She is here to guard the Druid's Guild and her superior knowledge of
offensive as well as defensive spells make her a deadly opponent.
3029.name: the dryad~

3030.room_name: A zombie is guarding the entrance.
description:
It is here to guard the Vampire's Guild, and it's unwavering devotion
to it's masters makes it a deadly opponent.
3030.name: the zombie~

3193.room_name: A Large Black Crow circles around in the air here.
description: The Crow looks mean and wants to peck your eyes out.
3193.name: the crow~

3036.room_name: Phil stands behind the bar cleaning some glasses.
3036.name: Phil~

3066.room_name: An alley cat hisses at you.
description: The alley cat is half starved and more than a little feral.
3066.name: an alley cat~

3040.room_name: Justin The Bartender is here,cleaning some bar glasses.
description:
Justin is a tall skinny bartender.He has light brown hair
that looks awful.He is here cleaning some glasses so that
his bar can be the best in Westbridge.
3040.name: the bartender~

3041.room_name: A waiter is going around from one place to another.
description: A tired looking waiter.
3041.name: the waiter~

3042.room_name: A retired sorcerer works as a waiter, serving customers.
description:
A man who in his young days was a famous sorcerer but now leads a quiet,
peaceful life as a waiter.
3042.name: the waiter~

3043.room_name: A waiter who seems to have reached contact with God.
3043.name: the waiter~

3044.room_name: A waiter who knows where all his customers keep their money.
3044.name: the waiter~

3045.room_name: A waiter who easily could kill you, and still carry quite a few firebreathers.
3045.name: the waiter~

3046.room_name: Filthy is standing here, spit polishing some bar glasses.
description:
Filthy looks like SHIT! He's tattoed from head to foot,
looks like he has not bathed in a week and the only
thing to cover the smell is the smell of piss in the
bar.
3046.name: Filthy~

This mob simulates a "once per boot" type reset by allowing the Sword of the RoK

3069.name: the cityguard~

3060.name: the {CW{cestbridge {CC{cityguard{x~

description: Seems someone just likes to keep things tidy.

description:
The tamed Wolf is basically a wolf who has lived here so long
that he is tamed as a pet.
3062.name: the tamed dog~

3063.room_name: A berserker is here, looking for victims.
description: He looks pretty mean.
3063.name: the berserker~

3064.room_name: A singing, happy drunk wanders around, singing about...nothing.
description: A drunk who seems to be too happy, and to carry too much money.
3064.name: the drunk~

3065.room_name: A beggar is here, asking for a few coins.
description: The beggar looks like she is fed up with life.
3065.name: the beggar~

2810.room_name: Justin the Bartender stands behind the bar, cleaning mugs.
description: A small skinny guy stands behind the bar cleaning bar mugs.
2810.name: Justin~

2811.room_name: Tony Jr stands here serving out pizza and calzonie.
description:
A small boy stands here in front of a push cart, which contains how
steaming pizza.
2811.name: Tony Jr.~

2812.room_name: An invisable specter floats above all here.
2812.name: An invisable specter~

2813.room_name: {GMo{Grz{Ga {wis here, aiding travelers with her healing.{x
description:
She is a frail looking human woman, aged and experienced in all healing
services customers may require. She wears a friendly smile, patiently
waiting to assist.
2813.name: {GMo{Grz{Ga{x~

2814.room_name: {YQ{yuincy {wstands behind the bar, serving up your drinks.{x
description:
This well built Saytr bears a smug grin, giving you a glance over before
serving up your drink of choice. He looks quite capable of handling any
who attempt to skip out on thier tab.
2814.name: {YQ{yuincy{x~

description: You see the Street.

3027.name: Entrance to the Guild of Thieves
description: This is the entrance hall to the thieves' and assassins' guild.  It is
a place where the unwary can lose both their life and their money if they
are not careful.  To the south is the Street of Death and there is a hatch
in the floor leading to the thieves' bar.

3106.name: Park Cafe
description: This fine establishment is the Park Cafe, a very well lighted, cosy
place.  The cafe is built from large logs and resembles a rustic cabin.
The park can be seen through the windows in the northern wall, along
with the duck pond.  Through the southern window there is a view of
the comings and goings on the street.

2832.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street widens here to a small open area where several people
can be seen loitering.  To the west is a dark, hole in the wall place
with a hanging sign above the entrance.  The sign reads simply the
{RPIT{x, and is on the verge of falling over.  This seems like a bad
part of town.

3082.name: A Quiet Corner in the Park
description: This small patch of grass is set a small distance away from the
main path through the park.  It is surrounded by flowering bushes
and small butterflies flutter from blossom to blossom.  In this
place, the troubles of everyday life in the city seem miles away.
You see Westbridge Way.

3010.name: General Store Of Westbridge
description: This is a large, fully stocked General Store. The building looks
very new and has the smell of fresh supplies.  Shelves are stocked
full of goodies to take on adventures around the realms.  The
general store owner sells wares with a grin from ear to ear. A sign
hangs on the wall.
You see the eastern end of Street.

3056.name: Fountain of Youth Apothecary
description: An old man putters around behind the counter, making strange love potions
and curative philtres.  He is eager to greet new patrons and relieve them
of their burdensome coins.  Judging from the furnishings, he's been made
very wealthy by his trade.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2830.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: Judge and Coffin Street intersect here, with Judge Street
running west and Coffin Street north and south.  To the east
rises an impressive station house, set in brightly polished
ivory with two large doors.  Enforcers belonging to the Order
of Judgment regularly enter and exit the building.

2922.name: In the southwest tower
description: This is a small circular room within the southwest tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the north and west.

2913.name: Atop the northern wall
description: A walkway leads atop the southern wall of Westbridge.  Down below,
the great plains extend far to the north and a mountain range is just
visible.  Archways to the east and west lead into city watchtowers.

2886.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal street runs north and south beside the western wall of
Westbrige.  There are several nondescript buildings lining the
street but none of them allow entry from here.  The street meets
the Street of Death just to the south.

2816.name: Beltaine's Chapel of Danu
description: An empathic wave of holy might radiates from the chamber.  Within,
rosemary is strung from the ceiling, bunched with assorted herbs.
Tomes of ancient lore litter the floor in an entropic pattern and
wisps of incense soothe all about with the sweet sent of jasmine.
Toward the center of the room, a ward of protection pulses in a
hypnotic rhythm.  Interwoven among the runes, the Dreaming brushes
this part of the world and leaves a feeling of tranquillity compared
to no other.  A silver plaque is mounted by the entrance of the
chapel.

2848.name: Market Square Pub
description: This is a dimly lit neighborhood pub.  The walls are brick and
adorned with different pictures.  The pub is very gently lit and
cigarette smoke lingers the air.  In one corner there is a pool
table ready for a game.  Men are often lined up on the bar,
drinking their heads off.  Behind the bar are shelves filled with
all kinds of spirits.  A staircase leads upwards.
You see the Street.

3049.name: Dick's Warehouse of Boats
description: This open building is filled with racks of rafts and canoes all stacked
on top of each other.  There is an exit to the street to the north.  There
is a wide boat ramp leading down toward the river.  Across the river can
be seen a small boat landing built off of Kate's Diner.
You see Austral Square.
You can see a rickety bridge to your northwest, leading back into
Central Westbridge.  A rustic dock connects the Diner with the Westbridge
River, and a boat or two floats lazily past.  Across the river you can see
the Levee and the Guild of Thieves, but they seem very far away from all
of this...

3150.name: Kate's Diner
description: The smells of baking bread and simmering stew entice patrons through
the doorway of the diner.  No greasy spoons to be seen here-- the
booth walls are covered in casual paisleys; the chairs are carved wood,
rescued from garage sales.  Most tables have chess or backgammon boards
carved and painted on their fingertip-smooth tops.  The refrain of some
classic musical production blends with the dusty golden light and the
wonderful smells to put customers completely at ease.  A huge picture window
looks out over the Westbridge River, and a doorway leads down onto the dock
and the South Bank river landing, while the main entrance to the south
exits out to River Street.
On most days Kate can be found here, testing a batch of stew or brewing
a special pot of cinnamon coffee, eerily just in time for your arrival.
Pull up a chair, perhaps play a game, and take time out to talk.

3254.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: This is Main Street, Westbridge, one of the most well traveled
thoroughfares in all the realms.  The pavement is well worn by many
years of traffic.  Gas lamp lights line either side of the street.

2927.name: Top of the northeast tower
description: A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the north, a wall of
mountains rise up out of the plains.  The north sea is just visible
through a break in the mountains.  Far to the east, it's possible to
just make out the spires of another city.  Spiral stairs lead down
into the tower.

3066.name: The Westbridge Courier
description: A plain door opens up to a small but well-kept office.  A few cubicles
are in the office and secretaries can be heard chatting behind the walls.
A large counter is on the far wall of the office with a man standing behind
it.  Boxes, papers, and the like are strewn about the counter, awaiting
transport to parts unknown.

2857.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: This area is the greener side of Westbridge--better known as the
park walk, which includes the city park, surrounding shops, apartments,
and cafes.  A quaint little cafe sits on the north side of the street
with a sign that reads {RPark Cafe{x.  Judge Street continues through to
the west and further to the City Plaza to the east.

2888.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: Main Street runs north and south all the way through the city
of Westbridge.  Gas lamps line the side of the street on either
side.  The pavement is well worn from the regular flow of traffic.

2903.name: Base of the southeast tower
description: This is a small circular room at the base of the southeast guard
tower.  Spiral stairs lead further up into the watchtower.  To the
north is the intersection of South and Coffin.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2822.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: This is the eastern end of the Street Of Life, nearing Coffin Street.
To the west can be found Tony's Pizza, The Yawning Portal Inn, and
eventually Main Street.  To the east, the eastern wall of Westbridge
looms in the distance.

2918.name: Atop the eastern wall
description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Not much
can be seen from here since mountains block the view to the east.
A small river flows through an arch in the wall far below.  The wall
extends to the south.  To the north is an archway leading to the
eastern gatehouse.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3395.name: {BThe {WG{*reat {WS{*tone {WB{*ridge {Bof {WWe{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: The Great Stone Bridge Of Westbridge.  The original wooden one was
destroyed by the famous Ragnarok that still lingers somewhere overhead.
While crossing the bridge, it is easy to notice the fine stone work that
makes its construction.  The bridge stretches over the River Of Westbridge,
which flows into various caverns and, rumors tells it, all the way to the
Sands Of Sorrow.  Newly created "Makou Gas Lights" lead across the bridge,
casting a greenish light over the water.  The Crier Square of Westbridge
stands to the north.  A short distance to the south is the great green Park
of Westbridge.
You can see the heavily guarded southern gate of Westbridge.

3128.name: On the Concourse
description: You are walking around the scenic concourse as it continues its path around
the city of Westbridge.  The south gate of the city lies to your east, and the
southwestern corner of the city wall is west.  Emerald Avenue stretches out
to the north.

3107.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: This well-traveled road the Main Street of Westbridge.  Gas lamp
lights line the side of the street on either side.  South of here is
the {RMarket Square{x.

3115.name: Path in the park
description: You are in the park.  The paths lead north and east.  Eastwards is the
park entrance and to the west you see a small pond. To the south you
see the Temple Of Oghma.
You see Westbridge Way.
Most of them appear to be very old and dusty.
Some of them are transparent enabling you to see that some contain colored
powders while others contain body parts of various animals.
Each scroll is stored in a leather tube that protects it from moist.

3033.name: Tim the Enchanter's Magic Shop
description: This is a small room that smells of rare chemicals and substances.
A large desk divides the room in two and on the wall behind it are
numerous shelves crammed with jars, bottles, books and scrolls of all
sorts and sizes.

3202.name: {CWe{cstbrid{Cge's {YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{x
description: North of here you see Crier Square.  The river flows from east to
west.  The riverbanks are too steep to climb.  A bridge passes
overhead, connecting Westbridge to the promenade.  A large stone
walkway runs under the bridge and airships are allowed to tie up here
under the bridge.  On one side of the river a large barrels of fuel
stand.
{x  To the north built into the river wall and under the bridge stands
Phil's Bar, a popular hang out amounst airship pilots and adventurers.

3068.name: {YPa{Wxi{Yan {WJa{wil{*h{wou{Wse{x
description: The room, just faintly lit by torchs hanging in scones at both ends
of the room, appears to be a prison where the Paxians can lock up
criminals.  Large, steel cages line the walls, each locked up tightly.
Many of the cells are currently occupied by riffraff and thugs.  The
stale smell of urine and sour milk permeates the entire room, and only
the small gaps under the door offer any air to circulate throughout
the room.  There is a desk right by the door, with a bored looking
guard sitting behind it.  He is propping his head up with his hand,
and idly playing with some cards.

3075.name: {CP{cor{Ct {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Re{cpa{Cir S{cho{Cp {&({YP{yx{YF{&){x
description: The smell of grease, oil and makou fuel is heavy in the air, a
stench so great that no one except someone without a nose could
resist.  The repair shop was dug out from underneath Westbridge in the
side of the riverbank, the bank that is now kept at bay from the large
stone walls that make up Airship Park.  The entire building is filled
with airship parts, engines, iron hull plates, and tools which lie
around on the ground.  The floor is covered with oils and grease, the
cause of the stench.
{x  Type HULL HELP to learn how to repair your own airship.
You see the House of Fetish.

3377.name: Entrance to the House of Fetish
description: This is a dim and narrow entrance hall for the House of Fetish.  There's
not much to see, just a man in a three piece suit checking ID's and waving
people through.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

3100.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: This is the intersection of Arsenal and River Street.  Arsenal continues
north, against the western wall of the city, and south, by the southwest
part of town better known as the Westbridge Neighborhoods-- "a nice place
to live".  River Street begins to the east, following near the river all
the way to the eastern part of town.  The city wall stops abruptly here
and veers far to the west, shaded slightly different in the stones which
are still rough from fresh cuts.  It appears as if the city was expanded
not too long ago to make room for the growing neighborhood.  To the west
begins the Street of Silences in the neighborhood of Westbridge.

3136.name: Park Road
description: You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the south the road goes on and to the
west is the Road Crossing.

3114.name: Pond
description: Splash!  This is the middle of the duck pond in the park.  Swans
can normally be found gliding about on the still water.  Dry land
is available to the west, south, or east.

2919.name: Atop the eastern wall
description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Not much
can be seen from here since mountains block the view to the east.
The wall extends to the north.  To the south, an archway leads
into one of the city watchtowers.
The concourse heads south, passing by a beautiful park.

3270.name: On the Concourse
description: The strong stone walls of Westbridge rise up to the west, keeping evil at bay.
The concourse heads towards a bridge to the north, and continues south
alongside a beautiful park.

3355.name: Andy's Pub
description: The busy pub is filled with patrons.  People are laughing and
singing.  A minstrel plays his lute in another part of the pub, and a
few people are even dancing.  Andy, the pubs owner, wanders around and
checks to see that the needs of his customers are met.  The bar is to
your north.  East of you is another section of the pub.  You know that
there are rooms to be had somewhere around here...

3135.name: Park Road
description: You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the north the road goes on and to the
east is the Road Crossing.  To the south, the ancient cliffs rise from deep
under the ground, forming a wall. You see the Temple of Shar to the north.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 500 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 501 Westbridge Way, Westbridge

2812.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: This is Westbridge Way, a great place for shops.  Nearby, to the
west are the large heavy gates of the western entrance of Westbridge.
Market Square lies further east.  To the north, a large building stands,
reading {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{Wun{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{x.  South of here is the entrance to the
{CMages Guild{x.
As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.

3028.name: {BThieves' Bar{x
description: The bar of the thieves.  Once upon a time this place was beautifully
furnished, but now it seems almost empty.  It begs the question if the
furniture may have been stolen.  To the east is the yard, and up a
ladder is the entrance hall.
You see the Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see the Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3025.name: {CFe{cstival Squa{Cre{x
description: This is the well known Festival Square.  Many people pass by as they
enjoy all the sights of Westbridge.  The Street of Death crosses west
and east.  A short ways to the north is Market Square and to the south
is Crier Square.  Festival Square and Crier Square are actually locked
together, the bricks interlocked together to form one large square.
Park benches line the sides of this square.  Further to the west can
be seen a large brick building, with a sign that reads "Casino Nights".
The road going east and west seems a bit narrow and dark.

3086.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{callway{*]{x
description: A small hallway here reveals two doors, one to the west and one to
the east.  The door to the west is labeled Sleeping Quarters.  The
door to the east is labeled Mess Room.  To the north is the main room
of the Station House.  The south wall is covered in pictures surrounding
a map of Westbridge.

3134.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Emerald Avenue makes a bend as it meanders through a series of
alleys between the various shops and temples on the south end of
the city.  Tall buildings line either side of the street.
You see Mercy's counter.
You see Nemesis' private dungeon.
You see Clem's counter.
You see the entrance hall.
You see something.

3378.name: House of Fetish
description: This large room is more reminiscent of a dark dungeon than a shop.
Indescribable contraptions hang from the ceiling and walls, and the
floor is littered with ropes and leg cuffs.  To the east and west
are counters with sales clerks and to the north is a large brass
door.  A set of stairs lead up.

2810.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: This part of Main Street is halfway between Market Square to the
north and Festival Square to the south.  The brick buildings on either
side of the street stand three stories tall and have an old fashioned
look to them.  To the east is the {RJeweller's Shop{x, where one can find
gems at affordable prices.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 110 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 112 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2814.name: {BThe {RB{rank {Y& {RC{rhapel {Bof {CMai{cn Street{x
description: The well traveled path of Main Street leads north and south.  To the
west is a large temple, dedicated to healing those who are in need.
The temple's patrons are healed by magical powers, given out by different
mages.  To the east stands the {RFirst National Bank Of Westbridge{x, ready
for all financial transactions.
You see the concourse.

3140.name: Penny Lane
description: You are on Penny Lane.  The narrow road continues north and west, and
the concourse intersects this street to the east.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 303 Coffin Street, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

3267.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: This section of Coffin Street is just north of the East Gate of the
city.   Further north, the street eventually leads to the Westbridge
Train Station.  To the east is the Eastern Gatehouse.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 705 River Street, Westbridge

2826.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: You are on River Street.  To the south are the long walls of various
buildings.  To the north is a a large building featuring a prominent
that reads "{RWestbridge Pawn Shop{x".  Through the windows of the pawn
shop can be seen all matter of trash and treasure.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2818.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: Main Street continues north and south through the city.  To the
west are several quaint apartment buildings set just behind a large
meeting hall.  It appears that they can be accessed through the street
that intersects just north of here.  To the east is an older building,
converted to ye olde convenience shoppe and quick tavern, better known
to the citizens of Westbridge as the {RQuick-Mark South{x.  It seems
deserted, though.
You see South Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge.

2835.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: The high wall bordering the south side of Westbridge casts its
shadow over South Street.  This area is often frequented by bums
and is notorious for pickpockets.  The {YTemple of Chauntea {xsits to
the south.  It resembles a greenhouse and seems out of place in the
dilapidated surroundings.
You see Selduth Street.

3368.name: Entrance to Druid's Guild
description: A slender tree grows right in the center of this room, its trunk
curved ever so slightly in an enticing way.  Upon closer inspection,
that tree isn't just a tree, it's a dryad!  An exit leads west back
to Main Street.  A small entrance to the bar is down a set of stairs.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2842.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: This tree-lined section of Arsenal Street continues beside the
Westbridge neighborhoods.  Although the neighborhoods are a more
recent development, all of the greenery looks well established.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

3052.name: Outside West Gate of Westbridge
description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the west you
can see the edge of a big forest. A small dusty trail leads north along the
wall.
The stairs lead back down to the pub.

3359.name: The Quest Master's Chambers
description: You stand inside the top story of the Pub.  Here you see a large
room, basically the size of the whole building.  The walls are covered
in draps of diffrent colors, and religious symbols hang from the wall.
The room has no furniture, only pillows on the floor, where you see
some lushes woman and men sitting, looking towards the master, Quija.
Quija sits above all the rest, meditating, and watching over his
followers.  A servant sits next to him, holding a small tray of
drinks.  A sign stands next to Quija, which reads "AREA QUESTS" on the
top.  You see the staircase going downwards.

2851.name: Second Story of the Pub
description: Here is the second story of the Market Square Pub.  A large
balcony in the corner overlooks Market Square.  A few tables
are located on the balcony, allowing a view of the people of
Market Square.  Downstairs is the main bar.
You see the inner sanctum.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.

3003.name: Cleric's Bar
description: The bar is one of the finest in the land, lucky it is members only.  Fine
furniture is set all around the room.  A small sign is hanging on the wall.

3222.name: Monk's Meditation Chamber
description: This room is full of staves along the walls, all well used and
worn smooth by years of being handled.  Candles line the floor
along the walls, setting a soft glow and light heat to swirl
about the room.  Incense burns in a couple of strategically
placed spots between the candles.  In the center is a large
cushion for the guildmaster to sit and meditate and guide fellow
monks on their path.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.

3369.name: Druid's Bar
description: Arcane smells and a hint of incense in the air lend the feeling that this
isn't so much a bar as it is an apothecary.  A small sign is hanging on the
wall.

3089.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CS{cleeping {CQ{cuarters{*]{x
description: Bunk beds fill up most of the room u, with the exception of a little
space to walk in between and footlockers at the end of each row.  This
is the daily living quarters of the law enforcers.  One shift sleeps
while the other patrols the city.  These quarters remain quiet except
during the shift change.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2820.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: This is the southern end of Main Street, just before it reaches
South Street and the south gate of Westbridge.  To the west is an
imposing building constructed of large marble blocks, the Cityguard
Headquarters.  Within lies the city jail.  The street continues to
the north and south.
You see Westbridge Way.
You see that this is truly delicious pastry.
The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water
and your soul sing.
| {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|
|               {wbut only if the shopkeeper deals in      {b|
|               {wthat kind of item.                       {b|
| {GVALUE {g<{citem{g> {g- {wthe shopkeeper will offer you a price   {b|
|                {wfor your item, if he is interested at   {b|
|                {wall.                                    {b|

| {WBUY #*<item> will buy multiples of the item, up to a   {b|
|  {Wlimit of 50 per transaction (example: buy 5*pie).     {b|

3009.name: Tom's Bakery
description: Here is the interior of a small bakery.  A sweet scent of danishes
and fine bread fills the room.  The items are all arranged in fine
order on the shelves and seem to be of the best quality.  A small
sign is on the counter.

2859.name: Steps of the Church
description: A large cathedral stands here, with steps leading up to a pair of
ornate doors.  Organ music can be heard filtering out through the
doors; some upbeat, some eerie.  The scent of both well oiled and
burnt wood is in the air.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 602 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.

3044.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: The Street Of Death continues its way through western Westbridge.  The
{RLeather Shop {xsits to the north.  There is a very large and colorful building
with a large sign on the south side.  The sign reads "{BC{ba{Cs{Bi{bn{Co {RN{Gi{Yg{Mh{Rt{Gs{x".

3374.name: Entrance to Vampire's Guild
description: A gate swings lazily upon rusty hinges, creaking from countless
centuries of use.  Just beyond the gate, burning red eyes can be seen
and a ghostly white hand beckons for entry.  Unintelligible whispers
seem to linger in the air asking unknown questions. A stairway leads
underground.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 606 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 607 Street Of Death, Westbridge
It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.

3026.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: Here, just east of Festival Square, runs the Street Of Death.  To the
south is the {CThieves Guild{x.  The sounds of a variety of animals can be
heard coming from the {RPet Shop{x to the north.  The street continues
west and east.

2855.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: Judge Street continues west here and ends shortly to the east at
Coffin Street.  A few large, run-down buildings line the street on
either side.  It seems this area has been somewhat neglected.
You see the crypt.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.

3375.name: Vampire's Bar
description: There are several ghostly-white beings relaxing in this crypt-like
underground bar.  Seated in line along the bar are several obviously
living people, each bearing several bite-marks.  It is a mystery
whether they are food or just tomorrow's vampires.  A small sign
hangs on the wall.

2885.name: Below The Ruins of the Casino

3300.name: {YC{yrypt {*of {RD{respair {xSecondary Holding Room
description: {Y<<<{RImmortals Only{Y>>>{x
{x
This room is here to hold mobs and items essential for the correct
operation of the Crypt of Despair.  Do not purge any mobs or objects
you may find in this room, or load any additional mobs or objects into
this room.  Thank you.
| {WFrom level 1-15 when you die, your corpse and fist will {b|
| {Wend up in this Morgue. After level 15, your corpse and  {b|
| {Wfist will lie in the place you died (see HELP DEATH for {b|
| {Wmore information).                                      {b|

3054.name: City Morgue
description: The morgue is clean, wet, and dimly lit.  This is the place good
and neutral aligned people go when they die.  Evil ones go to hell.
A small healing pool sits in the middle of the room.  Rows of people,
both dead and alive, are lined against the wall.  A healer stands in
the middle of the room chanting healing spells.  A sign hangs here.
You see the Temple Square.
These Are The Rules Of The Healing Wound Inn:
- NO FIGHTING
- DO NOT WAKE OTHER PEOPLE
- NO CANCELLING EACH OTHER (w/o permission), OR CASTING SPELLS OF WAR

3008.name: Healing Wound Inn
description: People of all kinds can normally be found resting within this
large inn.  Most will sit around the healer, telling stories about
their last adventure. The owner of the inn, a former adventurer
himself, stands here giving and selling spells. A large featherbed
rests here, just big enough for two. There is a large sofa against
the east wall and a huge pool with bubbles that looks like ten men
could fit in it.  A {gsign{x hangs on the wall.

3387.name: Small Booth
description: You step into a large booth. A large table sits in the middle of the
booth. The red booth seat curls around the table, holding many people
to sit here. To the south is an opening with a curtain on it.
You see The Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see The Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see stairs leading into a tunnel.

3303.name: {BThe Intersection of {CMai{cn {B& {&L{*if{&e{x
description: This is the intersection of Main Street and the Street Of Life.  To the
north, a large temple can be seen with the north wall of Westbridge beyond.
A sign hangs on the corner indicating that a Pizza Parlor, an Auction House
and The Yawning Portal Inn are to the east.  A large set of stairs lead down
under the temple, and northward to the north gate.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

3252.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: The walls of Westbridge tower high to the east, helping to keep the
city safe from its enemies... hopefully.  An intersection with a dark
Street lies north, and a bridge over the Westbridge river is south.
Beyond the bridge Coffin Street continues into the southern part of
Westbridge.
You see the city gate.
The trail continues around the City of Westbridge.
You see the plains.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

3053.name: Outside East Gate of Westbridge
description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the east the
plains stretch out in the distance. To the north a small dusty trail follow
the city wall.

3079.name: {YZ{yalan's {*B{wa{*r{x
description: {*This {wfine{* establishment {*has been burned to the ground, smoldering{x
{*ruins {*of the bar and tables jut up out of the ground in various{x
{*places as the{x {*wrath of Nisstyre is well apparent.{x

2904.name: Eastern Gatehouse
description: This small room is built directly into the city wall.  There is a
mechanism for lowering the siege door for the east gate built into
the wall.  Unfortunately, the mechanism seems to be rust locked
from years of neglect.  A staircase leads up to the top of the
gatehouse.  Coffin Street is to the west.

3074.name: Below Kate's Diner
description: A small wooden dock extends out onto the Westbridge River, providing
a perfect spot for Kate's customers to arrive by boat.  The gentle
waters lap against the pilings of the dock.  Across the river can be
seen the boat launch for Dick's Warehouse of Boats.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar, just like the wall.
You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.

3051.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: The road continues north and south next to the western city wall, which
towers overhead.  North of here is a bridge across the river.  To the east
is the {YTemple of Silvanus{x where the sounds of nature can be heard.
You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3019.name: Mage's Laboratory
description: This is the Magical Experiments Laboratory.  Dark smoke-stained stones
arch over numerous huge oaken tables, most of these cluttered with strange-
looking pipes and flasks.  The floor is covered with half-erased pentagrams
and even weirder symbols, and a blackboard in a dark corner has only been
partially cleaned, some painful-looking letters faintly visible.  A well in
the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the
depths.

2863.name: The {YP{Wa{YX{x Hall
description: The walls of this hall, made completely of marble, tower over even
the tallest man, stretching high into the air.  Massive, smooth marble
pillars line the walls, supporting the ceiling high above.  Between
each pillar, a tapestry is hung depicting each of the clans that makes
up the PaX.

3071.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street continues north and south along the western wall.
The barren faces of brick walled buildings line the eastern street,
some marked with grafitti.
You see your favorite place, the bar of divination.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3002.name: Cleric's Inner Sanctum
description: This is the inner sanctum.  A picture of the mighty Life is hanging on
the wall, just above the altar which is set against the western wall.  A well
in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from
the depths.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2828.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street continues through eastern Westbridge.  To the west
is a vacant lot covered in grass and a few medium sized trees.  To
the east is a large building belonging to Judge Incorporated.  The
street continues north and south.

3091.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{cess {CH{call{*]{x
description: A large room opens up to reveal a medium size table in the center.
Against the northern wall are cabinets surrounding a makou gas stove.
Next to the stove stands an iron ice box.  The surrounding walls have
random papers tacked to them, a few newspaper articles, and even a few
comical drawings.  A window to the east overlooks the gangland beyond.
The sign points in all directions:
North - Emerald Avenue.
East  - Park Road.
South - Emerald Avenue.
West  - Park Road.
Someone had added something with red paint, but it's been crossed out.

3120.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Tall buildings rise up on either side as Emerald Avenue continues
through the southeastern quadrant of Westbridge.  To the east is
the {YTemple of Lathander{x which seems to reflect the rays of the
morning sun.

2871.name: Below The Ruins of the Pawn Shop

description: Upon inspecting the rubble you notice a draft from below it...as if there's a passage underneath.

3390.name: West trail around Westbridge
description: You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and stops abrubtly to the south due to
rubble and fallen logs.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

3266.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: {CCoffin Street{x and {CThe Street of Life{x meet at this corner.  To
the north is the famous {RWestbridge Inn{x where many adventurers find
a room for the evening.  An opening in the wall east of here grants
access to the base of the northeast tower and, through that, the
{RTrain Station{x.  The two streets lead west and south from here.

3073.name: Below Dick's Warehose Of Boats
description: A wide boat ramp leads up to {RDick's Warehouse of Boats{x where all
variety of raft and canoe are sold.  To the south, the gentle waters
of the Westbridge River lap against the ramp.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 317 Coffin Street, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2829.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: To the east was once the X-Cops Police Station but that is now
long gone.  Now it is a large warehouse type building, owned by
Judge Incorporated, used for the storage and construction of
airships.  Coffin Street continues to the north and to the south
where it intersects with Judge Street.
You see Arsenel Street, Westbridge
You see South Street, Westbridge

2839.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: Here, along the southern wall of Westbridge, South Street runs east
and west.  This is a nicer area of the city, close to the private
neighborhoods.  To the west is the intersection with Arsenal Street.

3113.name: Path in the Park
description: A small, tree lined path leads through the southern side of the
park.  A soft carpet of green grass lies to each side of the path
and there are several decorative statues to be admired.  A few
benches have been placed in shady spots, perfect for relaxing. To
the north is the edge of a small pond.
You see the House of Fetish.
The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.

3380.name: Clem's Counter
description: There is a long counter set against the gray, dungeon like wall
of the room.  Clem can normally be found behind the counter, ready
to sell his customers whatever they desire.  There is a small note
on the counter.

3116.name: Eastern Park Entrance
description: You are standing at the eastern end of the park.  A small path leads west
into the park.  Going east through the entrance you will reach Emerald
Avenue.

3077.name: {CR{coom {Co{cf {CW{car{x
description: {x
{cStone walls are covered in {Cweapon racks and suits {cof armor.  Tapestries
{cdepicting various scenes {Cof battle add vivacious{c sparks of color. Grand
{cchandeliers hang  by th{Cick ropes from high  ce{cilings and cast a dancing
{cglow  of light  over {Ceverything.  Between ra{ccks of  sturdy weapons  and
{cwoven tapestries,  {Ctall windows open  to t{che Waterdeep Gardens,  giving
{cview to the  well{C-tended treasure  withi{cn. A wide set of  stairs in the
{cmiddle of the r{Coom leads downward to t{che city of Westbridge.{x

3334.name: Training Yard
description: You stand in a large yard here. Men and women all around are
screaming and fighting. These are people in training. A large
man stands in the middle of the yard, yelling commands.

3037.name: The Westbridge Beacon Inn
description: A small lobby opens up from the diner/bar to the south.  A small
desk stands to one side, with four boxes behind it.  A small desk
clerk sits behind the desk, going over some papers.  There is a small
round couch in the center of the room, but besides that, there isn't
anything else.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

3047.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet {CB{cr{&id{cg{Ce{x
description: A sturdy stone bridge allows Arsenal Street to cross the river.  The
bridge is built out from the western city wall and the river flows west
through an opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.  To the east,
beside the river, is an odd looking building painted bright orange with
purple trim... it appears to be the {RMob Factory{x.
{wYou see a {RN{YE{rW{w direction off in the west.
You see the southern gate.
The green forests of the Miden'nir are south, hiding countless goblin warriors.

3256.name: Outside South Gate of Westbridge
description: The Main Street of Westbridge transitions here to a dirt path just
outside the strong wooden gate on the southern walls of the city.
Guards eye all travelers suspiciously from the two towers on either
side of the gate as they stand watch to protect the city from the
goblins of the forest beyond.  A smaller dirt path branches to the
west, heading to the {RNew Adventurer's Shop {xand New Beginnings.

3389.name: West trail around Westbridge
description: You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and south along the wall.

2854.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x and {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: This marks the intersection of two streets: Judge Street running east
and west and Emerald Avenue running north and south.  Several small
residences line both of the streets.  The houses are in various states
of upkeep but most look quite comfortable.

2868.name: Bank Vault
description: The underground vault of the bank is as cool and quiet as a crypt. There
are rows upon rows of small compartments for holding the most precious of
jewels and other assorted valuables.  A set of stairs lead back up to the
bank lobby.

3069.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: North of here stretches the Great Stone Bridge of Westbridge.  The
river of Westbridge laps at the banks below, carrying boat traffic up
and down the river.  Airships can be seen floating to the east in the
Airship Park along the river.  South of here is the recently renovated
Southern Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

3040.name: Inside the West Gate of Westbridge
description: Just to the west are two small towers that have been built into the
city wall, connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.
Westbridge Way leads east and Arsenal Street leads both north and
south from here.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 706 Ocean Street, Westbridge

3103.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: River Street continues east and west as the sounds of Southern
Westbridge bustle from the many shops and patrons.  Here, the river can
be heard lapping at the pilings of the dock by {RKate's Diner{x to the north.
Emerald Avenue leads off to the south.

3223.name: {8A{mu{Mro{mra{x'{8s {CE{Bm{bp{cor{bi{Bu{Cm{x
description: This room is lined with shelving and bins filled with bits and
pieces of curiosities.  Armor and weapon racks hold an assortment of
ornate pieces throughout the shop.  Against the west wall is a large
polished wooden counter behind which sits a lovely young woman leafing
through an old book.  On the counter is a book titled "Aurora's whole
realm catalogue".
The concourse heads north, passing by a beautiful park.
You can see the southwest corner of the city wall.

3271.name: On the Concourse near the park
description: You are walking down the Concoruse, along the western wall of Westbridge.  To
the north, the road passes by a beautiful park, to the south, you can see
the southwest corner of the city wall.

3144.name: {RUNUSED{x
description: South Street ends here, next to a dangerous-looking run down
neighborhood.  You can enter the slums to the east, or head towards
the better part of town back to the west.  It occurs to you that this
isn't the happiest section of town.

3119.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Emerald Street continues running north and south through Westbridge.
A short distance to the south, it intersects with Judge Street.  A
large open building lies to the west with a sign hanging above the
walkway that reads "{RFirst National Bank of Westbridge{x".

3201.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
{x
{x  To the north the river wall opens up to allow a single airship
into the structure.  A sign above the boathouse doors reads "The
Westbridge Airship Repair Shop".  Another opening to the south
is the tunnel to the Westbridge Cargo Courier Port.
You see the practice yard.

3022.name: Bar of Swordsmen
description: The bar of swordsmen, once upon a time beautifully furnished.  But now the
furniture lays about the room in small pieces.  To the south is the yard, and
upstairs is the entrance hall.

3078.name: {CMai{cn Str{&eet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: A fresh built street leads off north towards the northern wall of
Westbridge.  To the south stands the Temple of Life, the meeting
place for the newly born, or freshly killed.  South of the Temple
is the city of Westbridge, filled with many shops, pubs and good
food.  The Healing Wound Inn is also south, which is a popular
healing place for Westbridge.  To the west sits the smoldering ruins
of a bar that seems to have been smited by the gods.  To the north
stands the Northern Gates of Westbridge.

3039.name: The Hallway
description: A small hallway extends north away from the lobby and diner.  On
either side is a door with a number on it.  The hallways ends here,
and a large window north looks out into the sky.  Room [3] is to the
west.  Room [4] is to the east.

2902.name: Base of the southwest tower
description: This is a small circular room at the base of the southwest guard
tower.  Spiral stairs lead further up into the watchtower.  To the
north is the intersection of South and Arsenal.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2813.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: Westbridge Way continues its way along the west-east path it takes.
To the east loon the large east gates of Westbridge.  To the west are
the shops of Westbridge Way, a good place to shop.  To the north is
the {CWe{Bstbrid{Cge Qu{Bi{Cck-M{Bar{Ct{x.  To the south is large open building
with a sign that reads '{RWestbridge Courier Check Point{x'.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2841.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street leads north and south through western Westbridge.
What used to be the western edge of the city has been expanded to
make room for the neighborhoods of Westbridge.  Just to the south
is an intersection beside the southern wall.
The sign on the door says:-
Cityguard Head Quarters

3111.name: Park Road
description: The road continues north and south.  A building is just west of here, you
notice a sign on the door.  The park entrance is to the east.

2926.name: Top of the northwest tower
description: You stand atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the north, a wall of
mountains rise up out of the plains.  To the west, the green canopy of
the Haon Dor forest extends as far as the eye can see.
Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

3314.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: The Street of Life runs east and west here.  To the north is a
wall of the Healing Wound Inn but the door lies around the corner
on Main Street.  To the south sits a {RSmall Pizza Parlor{x, the smell
of pizza wafting out into the street.

2928.name: Top of the southeast tower
description: A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the east, the beginning
of a mountain range blocks the view.  To the south, beyond the dark
canopy of the Miden'nir forest, the mountain range curves toward the
west.  Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
Area [Blackstaff's Tower] Room [32356] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20940]
Vnum:       [32356] - down to [20940] Key: [    0]  Exit flags: [none]
Area [NW of Waterdeep] Room [30936] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20979]
Vnum:       [30936] -south to [20979] Key: [    0]  Exit flags: [door closed]
Area [House of the Moon] Room [13974] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20927]
Vnum:       [20927] -west  to [13974] Key: [    0]  Exit flags: [none]
Area [The Trade Way] Room [33501] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20602]
Vnum:       [33501] -west  to [20602] Key: [    0]  Exit flags: [none]
Area [North of Waterdeep] Room [51500] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20786]
Vnum:       [51500] -west  to [20786] Key: [    0]  Exit flags: [none]

3080.name: Waterdeep South
description: {x
Welcome to Waterdeep, the city seems to be missing at the moment, please try back later.
{x
Now leaving Waterdeep, thank you for coming, please come back again.
{x
You see the river flowing west into the Forest of Haon-Dor.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  Looks pretty solid.

3200.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.

3087.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{ceeting {CR{coom{*]{x
description: A medium size table sits in the middle of the room, many chairs surrounding it.  The top of the table is covered

2901.name: Western gatehouse
description: This is a small room built into the city wall.  A mechanism for
lowering the siege door for the west gate is set into the wall, but
seems to be rust locked from years of neglect.  A small staircase
leads up to the top of the gatehouse.  Arsenal Street is to the east.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge.

2840.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: South Street leads east along the southern wall of the city.  Here
it intersects with what used to be the western most street in the city,
Arsenal Street, which runs northward alongside the neighborhoods of
Westbridge.  Cavern Road leads to the west into the southern housing
area.  To the south is the base of the southwest guard tower.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 306 Coffin Street, Westbridge

3070.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: The walls of Westbridge reach high overhead to the east, helping to
keep the city safe from its enemies... hopefully.  {RNisstyre's Tavern{x,
the famous sailor's dive, is west.  A bridge over the Westbridge river
lies north.  Beyond the bridge, Coffin Street continues into the northern
part of Westbridge.

2905.name: Eastern gatehouse
description: This small room is built directly into the city wall.  There is a
mechanism for lowering the siege door for the east gate built into
the wall.  Unfortunately, the mechanism seems to be rust locked
from years of neglect.  A staircase leads up to the top of the
gatehouse.  Coffin Street is to the west.
10  -  {8The {WGreat Axe {8of the {mNine {RH{Ye{Rl{Yl{Rs{x
20  -  {CE{wnc{Chan{wte{Cd {8S{Cpec{8ta{Ccle{8s{x

3122.name: Park Road
description: You are on Park Road which leads south and north.  Elm Street is east of
here.

2890.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street marks the eastern edge of Westbridge, following the
line of the eastern wall.  This section of road is less traveled,
given the lack of shops of buildings to enter.

2923.name: Atop the western wall
description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Swampland
extends to the west.  The wall continues to the north.  To the south,
an archway leads into one of the city watchtowers.

3204.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
You see the Temple Square.

3004.name: Entrance to Cleric's Guild
description: The entrance hall is a small modest room, reflecting the true
nature of the Clerics.  The exit leads east to the temple square.  A
short flight of stairs leads up to the cleric's bar loft area.
You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3373.name: Ranger's Study
description: This small room is filled with the sweet smells of cedar and warmth
from a fireplace that is burning hickory.  The fire provides the only
light here and a small bush is set close to it.  The bush is recognizable
as a rare witchwood bush, the most magical of hardwoods.  A well in the
middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from its
depths.
