Your face is reflected in its surface.
They are made from polished gold and looks as if they are securely fastened
to the smooth stone walls.

3034.name: Bob's Jeweller Super Shop
description: Here is a small, beautifully furnished room.  The warm light emanating
from the small oil lamps on the walls is reflected in the hard, polished
surface of the big mahogany desk that stands in the center of the room.
A small sign sits on the desk.

3062.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: The street leads north and south in the shadow of the eastern city wall.
To the east, the {YTemple of Mystra {xcrackles with arcane energy.  To the west
is the {RDragon's Hoard Emporium{x, a popular spot for business transactions.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.

2811.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: This is the western end of the Street of Death, just before it hits
Arsenal Street.  Further east can be found entrances to several shops
and the ever-popular Casino Nights.

3392.name: Crudely dug Tunnel
description: You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.

3130.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal street runs north and south beside the western wall of
Westbrige.  There are several nondescript buildings lining the
street but none of them allow entry from here.

3129.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Alongside the western wall of the city, Arsenal Street runs
north and south, marking the western edge of Westbridge.  To
the west is the dangerous {YTemple of Cyric{x.  To the east lies
the terrifying Church of Nightmares.
The waiting room is to the west.
This chair is really a masterpiece.  A chair where one can sit as comfortably
as in a bed.  All lecture halls should be equipped with these things.

3138.name: Mayor's Office
description: You are in the not very big office of the once great Mayor Drott of Westbridge.
A large burnt and completely destoryed desk is standing in front of an evenly
burnt armchair that looks so uncomfortable that Satan himself would not sit in
it. The walls are black and you see a bed made out of old junk. The story is the
town hall caught fire during the great hall, and Mayor Drott went crazy. After the
re-election he still wandered the street thinking he was mayor.

3261.name: The Westbridge Newbie School
description: You walk into a small building, and a small lobby.  In the center
of the lobby you see a small desk with a secretary sitting behind it.
To the south, you see a large sign that says "WESTBRIDGE CITY MORGUE".
A staircase leads upwards to the "NEWBIE SCHOOL".  Back north is the
city.

2833.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street continues north and south.  To the east is a run down
neighborhood separated from this part of Westbridge by a large wall.
To the west, there are several structures characteristic of the
southern part of the city: temples, taverns, and some residential
apartment buildings futher on the western side.
A sign on the door says, "Unauthorized Personel Prohibited".
To the south is the Westbridge Way.  Across the Street, you see the Grubby Inn.

3160.name: Melancholy's Maps
description: When the door to the shop is opened, sudden gusts of wind often
enter the shop, sending scraps of paper flying around the room.
This room is cluttered with old pieces of parchment, stacks of books,
and odd scraps.  A desk with slightly less clutter than the rest of
the shop is near the back wall.  A scroll case full of scrolls is
behind the desk.  A bookcase sits to the right and to the left is a
window overlooking a small garden.  A small door, half hidden by a
stack of books, leads to a room in the back of the shop.
The iron bars are broken, allowing passage through the hole in the wall.
Beyond the bars you see a dark tunnel.
bars

3205.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.

3132.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: This is the northern end of Emerald Avenue.  To the north, the
avenue ends where it intersects with River Street, just across
from Kate's Diner.  Modest sized buildings line the street on
both sides as Emerald Avenue continues north and south.

2916.name: Eastern gatehouse
description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.
You see machine dreams and taste violet phosphor.
You see the Street.

3050.name: Warehouse
description: Boxes and crates, oh my! This is Westbridge's Major Warehouse
where citizens store their things.  It is a giant building with
nothing but cages, boxes and crates.  A janitor walks around
sweeping the dirt off the floor.  Some boxes are stacked almost
like stairs, leading up into darkness.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
Hmm...some of the bars have been ripped out of the wall.  Enough to pass a
good sized raft or canoe, or perhaps even a barge.  You wonder what sort of
beast had the strength to do this.

3253.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet {CB{cr{&id{cg{Ce{x
description: A strong stone bridge spans the Westbridge River.  Below, the river
flows into an opening in the city wall that is sealed with strong metal
bars.  The bridge allows Coffin Street to continue along the length of
the city north and south of here.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2845.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: The street continues running north and south through the southwest
section of westbridge.  To the west are the recently constructed
neighborhoods of Westbridge.  To the south, Judge Street intersects
with Arsenal.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
Street of Life continues east.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3302.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: The Street of Life runs east and west through Westbridge.  The walls
of buildings line either side, though there are no entrances here to
gain access inside.  The street continues in both directions.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 205 Arsenel Street, Westbridge
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

3042.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street runs beside the western wall, just south of the West
Gate of Westbridge.  The road continues along the western wall in both
directions.  Just to the north it intersects with the Street Of Life.
A gatehouse is to the west.

3394.name: Westbridge's Water Source
description: A free flowing river of water flows here directly underneath Westbridge!
It's currents are much to fast to go swimming in, but along the side a small
pool of water has developed.  The water is crystal clear and taps directly
into the the whole water system of Westbridge.

3131.name: Park Road
description: You are at Park Road which continues north and south.
The walls are marked with lots of scratches.  Some of them spell sentences
like "JAIL IS BETTER THAN SQL" and "BIGFOOTDAMOOSE IS ALIVE".

3143.name: Jail
description: This is a dark and humid jail.  The dank stone walls are hard
and cold to the touch.  A heavy steel door is to the north.
You see the laboratory.

3018.name: Mage's Bar
description: The bar is one of the wierdest in the land.  Mystical images float around
the air.  Illusions of fine furniture appear all around the room.
| {WThis is one of many pawnshops that operates throughout   {b|
| {Wthe realms. Pawnshops will buy nearly any item, and      {b|
| {Ware a great place to find useful items that other people {b|
| {Whave sold. This pawnshop will only hold 100 items--any   {b|
| {Wbeyond that will not appear in the list.                 {b|
The puddles on the floor are filthy and exude a foul stench.

3170.name: Westbridge Pawn Shop
description: This is a very cluttered shop. All kinds of armor, weapons, clothing,
and gems line the walls.  It is so cluttered it seems as if one thing
is moved the whole mess may come crashing down. There is a nice man
sitting behind a counter, counting his gold pieces.  A small trapdoor
in the floor is almost hidden by the merchandise.

3123.name: Elm Street
description: You are on Elm street.  Park Road is to the west and Elm Street continues
in eastward direction.
You see Westbridge Way.

3021.name: Entrance to the Guild of Swordsmen
description: The entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen.  A place where one has to be
careful not to say something wrong (or right).  Down a set of stairs is the
bar and to the north is Westbridge Way.

3126.name: Southern Park Entrance
description: This is the southern end of the Westbridge park.  Lush grasses carpet
the ground and there are many different flowering bushes and trees growing
in well arranged locations.  A small, tree lined path winds its way lazily
around the park.  It also branches south, where it widens to become Park
Road.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see the city gate.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

3041.name: Inside the East Gate of Westbridge
description: To the east are small towers that have been built into the city
wall and are connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden
gate.  Westbridge Way leads west from here.  Coffin Street inter-
sects the street, heading north and south along the city wall.

2877.name: The Southern End Of The Wreckage

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

3316.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: This is the Street Of Life, east of Main Street.  To the north
is the entrance to a popular Westbridge establishment, {RThe Yawning
Portal Inn{x.  To the south is the shadowy gated entrance to the
{CVampire's Guild{x.

2924.name: Atop the western wall
description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  A small
river flows through an arch in the wall far below and disappears
into the forest beyond.  The wall extends to the south.  To the
north is an archway leading to the eastern gatehouse.

2909.name: Westbridge Quick-Mart
description: A sign hangs slightly askew above a deserted store.
{R|  {mThe {MW{mestbridge {CQ{Buick{CM{Bart{x "{YO{ypen {C24 {BHours {xA Day, {R7 {BDays{x A Week"  {R|{x

2891.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: The street continues north and south near the eastern wall of Westbridge.
To the east, the wall presses in close.  On the opposite side of the street
are several buildings, none of which open onto the street.

3084.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{cain {CR{coom{*]{x
description: A large room opens up with a massive oak desk in the center.  The
desk sits almost level with a human's head, making those who approach
it look upward.  The top of the desk is hidden behind iron bars, keeping
those who sit behind it safe from possible attacks.  To either side,
chairs line the half plaster and oak paneled walls.  There is a large
door to the south.  To the east is another door, only made from iron
bars.

2853.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: You find yourself on Judge Street just east of Main.  To the south
is the brightly lit Westbridge Quick-Mart, to the west is the Westbridge
City Plaza, and to the east is the intersection with Emerald Avenue.
You see the north gate of Westbridge.

3268.name: Tunnel Under the North Gate
description: This small tunnel leads under Main Street and the Temple of
Life, granting underground access to Westbridge.  A bright lamp
illuminates a stairway that leads up to the dusty road just
outside of the North Gate of Westbridge and the plains beyond.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 309 Coffin Street, Westbridge

3250.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street extends north and south along the eastern walls of the
city.  The wall casts its looming shadow across the street in the early
hours of the day, shortening with the passing of the sun.  A gatehouse
is to the east.

3133.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Emerald Avenue continues on its north and south path through
Westbridge.  To the north, the street intersects with Judge
Street.  To the south, the street continues on to the southern
wall of the city.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 610 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 611 Street Of Death, Westbridge

3046.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: This is the eastern end of the Street Of Death just before it ends into
Coffin Street.  The tall eastern wall of Westbridge can be seen in the
distance beyond Coffin Street.  There is a nondescript {Rwarehouse{x to
the south.  The {RFountain Of Youth Apothecary{x is north
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

2821.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: This is the western end of the Street of Life before it meets
Arsenal Street.  To the north is the entrance to the strangely
popular {RHouse of Fetish{x.  South of here can be seen the {YTemple{x
{Yof Celestia{x.
The Entrance To The Inn.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn.
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender.
List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer,
poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.

3007.name: Yawning Portal Inn
description: You are standing in one of the greatest bars in Westbridge.
Here there is alot of room for people to sit and relax.A
fireplace with a pair of chairs sits on the eastern wall.
The bar is to the north with a tall skinny bartender behind
it.
A small sign with big letters is fastened to the bar.
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2837.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: South Street runs here between the southern wall to the south and
the side of the Cityguard Headquarters to the north.  To the east is
Main Street and the south gate of the city.

2910.name: Western gatehouse
description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.

2865.name: The Hall of {WJu{ws{*t{wi{Wce{x
description: Walls made entirely of marble surround the room, with massive
pillars running parallel to the main entrance.  Opposite the door is
the Bar, where the judge is sitting, waiting to hear the cases before
him.  Engraved into the wall behind the bar is a warhammer with a a
scale perched on top of it, this is the holy symbol of Tyr, God of
Justice.  This is the hallway the Paxians use to judge the prisoners,
putting them before one of the Church of Justice for review and a fair
and just trial.

3092.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x
description: A large tunnel goes underneath Westbridge to the Cargo Courier,
located at the end of the tunnel.  To the north the tunnel opens up
into the Westbridge River, a large iron gate on either side sits
against the wall open.

2866.name: {GMos{gs cov{wered Co{gurty{Gard{x
description: {GA{gn old courtyard is here, just off of the Pax Lounge.  The stones,
of what appear to be ancient rocks, are almost completely covered in
moss, which seems to softly glow green.  The grass in this courtyard
does not appear to grow any taller than the mere inches that it is
already.  It is cool with dew, all day, as if it was magical.  The air
in this courtyard is perfect, crisp and cool, and smelling of flowers
and moss.  The blessings of {YCe{yl{wes{yt{Yia{g is upon this place.  {x

2915.name: Atop the eastern wall
description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  The top
of a strange tower is just visible above the forest east of here.
To the north, an archway leads into one of the city watchtowers.
To the south is the top of the eastern gatehouse.
The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.

3358.name: [W] Bar
description: A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub.  Mugs line a
shelf behind the bar.  Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids
decorate one of the lower shelves.  A large cask rests on a table
behind the bar.  A strong but friendly looking bartender stands next
to the cask polishing glasses.  A couple of the bar maids stand in a
corner and throw the most inviting glances your way.  At the corner of
the bar is a small hatch leading down into a shop on the lower level.
You can watch the patrons enter and exit the shop from this place in
secret.

2912.name: In the northwest tower
description: This is a small circular room within the northwest tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the east and south.
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see the southern gate.

3255.name: Inside South Gate of Westbridge
description: Two strong stone towers surround a heavy wooden gate set into the city
wall that is the south gate of Westbridge.  Main street leads north toward
the center of the city or south, out through the gate.  South Street runs
along the wall to the west and east.

3032.name: Pet Shop Store
description: This is the small dark room in which the Pet Shop Boy keeps his pets.
It is vital that this room be immediately after the pet shop.

3118.name: Park Road
description: This is Park Road, a small little lane which leads north and south,
connecting the park and Judg Street.  Ducks, birds and small animals
can often be seen frolicking about on the lush green grass.  A quaint
little cafe is accessible to the east.
You see the Inn.
You see Street of Life

3006.name: Entrance to the Yawning Portal Inn
description: You are standing in the entrance hall of the Yawning Portal Inn.  The hall
has been wisely decorated with simple but functional furniture.  A small
staircase leads up to the defunct reception room, and down into the dark.
The bar is to the east.

2892.name: Under the East Gate of Westbridge
description: You are between two small towers that have been built into the city
wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To
the east the plains stretch out in the distance.  Westbridge way leads
west from here.

2920.name: In the southeast tower
description: This is a small circular room within the southeast tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the north and west.

2858.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: This is the park area of Judge Street.  The walk through the park
lies north, accented by lush green grass and wide, empty lots on
both sides of the road.  South and west of here can be found the
western neighborhoods of Westbridge, better known as the nice part
of town.   Judge Street continues west and east.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 506 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.

3015.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: This is Wetbridge Way, the main route east and west through town.  To the
north is the {RGeneral Store{x.  To the west, the busy sounds of Market Square
can he heard.  {BWestbridge Way{x <{RR{W4{*2{W0{x> continues east and west.

2869.name: {R[{G- {-The Westbridge Beacon {G-{R]{x
description: Inside the large flying structure you find a large lounge type
area.  A large bar stands at the northern end, with a kitchen behind
it.  Hot food is coming in and out to the small tables spread in the
middle of the floor.  To one side you see a few couches and a healing
area.  More or less it looks like an Airship Roadside Diner.  A small
list of BOUNTIES hang on the western wall.

3393.name: Crudely dug Tunnel
description: You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2831.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street continues north and south.  To the east stand
an array of shoddy buildings separated by a large wall just next
to the street.  To the west is the {YTemple of Tempus{x.
You see a darkness trying to pull you in.
A holy light is drawing toward you.

3362.name: Church foyer
description: This is the foyer of a large cathedral.  It feels as if two opposing
spiritual forces are at work in this space; one pulling to the north,
and one pulling to the south.
You see a small foyer.
{B

The altar appears to have been carved from a single piece of obsidian.
Dark red stains cover it's surface.

3361.name: In Death's Chapel
description: Death's hateful gaze can be felt within the confines of this small
chapel dedicated to the force of Death.  The walls are covered in a
layer of black slime and the purest of evil seems to be radiating from
a large black altar in the center of the room.
You see the southern end of the temple of Death.

3367.name: Donation Room
description: This is a small room, set off to the side of the Temple of Life.
A note on the wall states that this is a place to leave unwanted
items for other travelers.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 508 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 509 Westbridge Way, Westbridge

3016.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: This is Westbridge Way.  To the north is the {Rweapon shop{x and to the
south is the {CWarriors Guild{x.  To the east the road leads out of town
and to the west can be found Market Square.
A set of stairs leads up to the reception area.

3356.name: Room in the Pub
description: This part of the pub is filled with dancing and singing.  A
wandering minstrel is on a chair in a corner with his lute.  A busty
red headed woman is standing near him and singing a tale of comedic
heroism.  Drunk men sit laughing at their tables and busy bar maids
weave through the crowd with full mugs and horns of ale and mead.
Another part of the pub is located to your west.  The bar is to the
north.  A set of steps occupy in a corner of the room.  They lead up
to the Questmaster's Chambers.

3093.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x
description: A large tunnel big enough for an airship runs north and south, to
the south it leads to the Westbridge Cargo Courier.

3014.name: {CMa{Wrke{ct S{Wqua{Cre{x
description: This place stands one of the greatest points in the realms, Market
Square.  Market Square is the center point for the city of Westbridge,
and also known to be the center point of the Western Great Realms.
This area features a huge cobblestone square, crowned with a fountain
and statue in the middle.  Park benches line the outer edges,
allowing people to rest.  The center fountain stands tall, a statue in
the middle of Nisstyre Bloodstoner with water flowing around the base.
Several streets lead off different directions.  Going east and west
from the square is {BWestbridge Way{x, a main route between the
major cities.  To the west can be found the Bounty Hunters Office,
Bakery and other shops.  To the east can be found The Quick-Mart and
General Store.  Going north and south is {BMain Street{x of Westbridge.
{WThe Healing Wound {WInn{x, and {WQuestmasters Office{x is north, the {WPark{x and
{WBank South{x.  A large sign hangs in the corner of the square, pointing
out the different shops.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 608 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 609 Street Of Death, Westbridge

3045.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: The Street of Death continues east and west between many different
buildings.  South of here is {RDick's Warehouse Of New & Used Boats{x.
North is the {CRangers Guild{x.  The street leads west toward Main Street
and east toward Coffin Street.

3067.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: South Street continues west along the southern wall of the city.
Here it intersects with the eastern perimeter street, called Coffin
Street, which runs along the slums of Westbridge.  To the east, South
Street ends at an alleyway where several vagrants and homeless loiter,
begging for change and generally causing trouble for the good citizens
of Westbridge.  Coffin Street leads north and to the south is the base
of the southeast guard tower.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 504 Westbridge Way, Westbridge

3013.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: This is Westbridge Way, passing east and west through the City of
Westbridge.  North of here is the entrance to the {RBakery{x.  Just to
the east is the bustling Market Square, the hub of all activity in
Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

3301.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: This is a western section of the Street of Life.  It seems the road
has recently been repaved with some new stone work having been laid
down.  The road stretches on to the east and west.

2856.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: This is the beginning of western Judge Street, just west of the City
Plaza.  North is a vacant lot, closed off from access to the street.
To the south is the side of the newly built city hall, bright and clean
with a modern twist to a traditional look in Westbridge.  Just east of
here is Westbridge City Plaza.

3203.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.

3038.name: The Hallway
description: A small hallway extends north away from the lobby and diner.  On
either side is a door with a number on it.  Room [1] is to the west.
Room [2] is to the east.

3109.name: Small path in the park
description: You are on a small path running through the park.  It continues west and
south and just north of here you see the southern wall of Park Cafe.
To the north you see The Temple Of Cyric.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.

3258.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x
description: Arsenal Street meets the usually crowded Street of Life which is
filled with shops and artisans.  The Street of Life stretches off to
the east, toward the far wall of the city.  Arsenal leads away to the
south  To the west is the base of the northwest tower of Westbridge.

3072.name: Gateway to the Mob Factory
description: A brickwork arch marks stairs going down into a large building
below.  Sounds of work can be heard as steam and smoke rises from
various holes and smokestacks.

2867.name: {xThe {YP{Wa{YX{x Lounge
description: This large room, filled with the chatter of Paxians, radiates with
an aura of power.  This is the resting place of the Guardians of
Westbridge.  Upon the walls hang the banners of the clans of the Pax
Faerunis Alliance.  They hang proudly, side by side, on display for
the world to see.  Scattered around the room are several couches, as
well as some tables and chairs.  And stretched along one wall is a bar,
serving drinks to the Paxians.  To the west, a cool breeze wafts in
from the courtyard.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 103 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see the air.

3005.name: {CTe{&mpl{ce S{&qua{Cre{x
description: Here is the middle of the Temple Square.  To the north, huge marble
steps lead up to the temple gate.  The entrance to a large cathedral
is to the west and {gThe Healing Wound Inn{x is just east of here.  A few
large cracks in the ground can be seen.
You see South Street, Westbridge.

2834.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: South Street continues alongside the southern wall of Westbridge.
The buildings here look distinctly more run-down than other areas
of the city, and it just gets worse to the east.  To the north is
a vacant lot littered with trash.
You find a table that's relatively vomit-free.
Bare, except for the holes.

3352.name: Nisstyre's Tavern
description: This is a small, dank establishment.  There is a large bar with a row
of drunken men sitting along it.  The walls are bare because patrons
either steal, or beat each other in the head, with whatever they can
get their hands on.  A booth sits to the north.

2917.name: Eastern gatehouse
description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.

3076.name: The Northern Gates Of Westbridge
description: Two massive iron gates rise above the ground here, surrounded by a
foot thick stone wall.  A large stone arch rises above the iron gates,
with "Westbridge" carved on either side.  The gates and surrounding
stone wall was built by the Tripower after the Great Vectorian
Invasion, in which the towns people of Westbridge fought against the
Vectorian Nation, destroying its army at these very walls.  Beyond the
walls the city street ends, and the Northern Plains begin.  The gates
lead to other areas like The Elven Valley, Mount Olympus, Makou City,
and the Ruins of Ofcol.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3029.name: Secret Yard
description: The secret underground practice yard of thieves and assassins.  To the west
is the bar.  An open well leads down into darkness where a rotten stench wafts
up.
You see a small foyer.
{B
| {WTo convert platinum to gold, or gold to silver, drop   {b|
| {Wone more piece than what you have.                     {b|
| {GExample{g: {wyou have 5 platinum, 8 gold, and need more    {b|
| {wgold to change your alignment. Simply drop 9 gold on   {b|
| {wthe ground, and you will then have 99 gold--enough for {b|
| {wthe priest's services!                                 {b|
Made of pure gold, the altar shines with an unearthly beauty.
Ancient runes cover it's surface.

3360.name: In Life's Chapel
description: Life's benevolence can be felt upon entering this small chapel
dedicated to the force of Life.  The church of Life is widely known
for helping those in good favor, and those who wish to be... for a
price.  A golden altar occupies the center of the room.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 502 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.

3012.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x
description: This is the western section of Westbridge Way.  To the south of
here is the entrance to the {RArmoury{x.  The street continues east
toward Market Square.  The {RMagic Shop{x is to the north and a little
ways west is the city gate.
You see Elm Street and the graveyard entrance.
The concourse continues to the north, towards an intersection with Penny Lane.

3273.name: On the Concourse at Elm Street
description: The air grows chill as you pass near the Elm Street graveyard.  The walls of
Westbridge are to the east, and the concourse continues to the north and south.
To your west, you see Elm Street at the graveyard entrance.

2850.name: Roof Of The Cafe
description: This is the roof of the Market Square Cafe.  To the east, Market
Square sits almost directly below.  All around, there is an excellent
view of the different buildings and the skyline of the city.  Several
small round tables are available, providing customers a place to enjoy
their coffee.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 203 Arsenel Street, Westbridge
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

3257.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street runs beside the western wall, just north of the West
Gate of Westbridge.  The road continues along the western wall in both
directions.  Just to the south it intersects with the Street Of Life.
A gatehouse is to the west.

3219.name: Grand Arena Loading Room
description: {x
Commands to control the Grand Arena:
"close the ga" : Closes the Grand Arena, and stops it from loading.
"reset the ga" : Closes the Grand Arena, and allows it to run on its own.
"restart the ga" : Resets the Grand Arena, and Opens it immediately.

3117.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Emerald Avenue continues north and south.  It is a somewhat narrow
street that sees less traffic than other parts of Westbridge.  To the
west is the {YTemple of Oghma{x.

3127.name: On the Concourse
description: You are at the southwest corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and east, and a watchtower is to the south. To the west you
see the Temple Of Lanthander.
More of the same.
Back down on the earth where you should be!

3057.name: In the air
description: WOW you can fly!  You are floating in the air above Temple Square of Westbridge.

3121.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x
description: Here is a bend in Emerald Avenue.  The road continues to the
east and south.  To the south, Emerald Avenue ends at South
Street in the shadow of the southern wall of Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see the sewers.

3030.name: {CCr{cier {CSq{cuare{x
description: Here is a beautiful square.  This is where the politicians come to talk
about, well, politics.  The ground is paved with small cut marble.  In
the center of the square is a large gazebo.  Benches line the sides of
the square.  There is a round hole with a lid on it, leading to somewhere
unknown. To the south is a beautiful bridge and the Park in the distance
beyond.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

2827.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin street runs north and south through Westbridge.  A few
wild flowers grow along the western side of the street.  To the
east is the northern end of what used to be the X-Cops Building
but is now a warehouse for Judge Incorporated.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3370.name: Druid's Holy Sanctum
description: This is the holy sanctum.  A wizened old woman occupies this room,
chanting very softly to herself.  On a table in the corner is a large
tome, and the walls are covered with creeper vines and flowers.  A well
in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft
from the depths.
You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3023.name: Tournament and Practice Yard
description: The practice yard of the fighters.  To the north is the bar.  A well leads
down into darkness.

3088.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{callway{*]{x
description: A small hallway runs north and south inside the OOJ Westbridge
Station.  The hall stretches north from here, ending to the south.
The southern wall is covered in small pictures of past residence of
this station house.  A door to the east is marked Locker Room, and a
door to the west is marked Sleeping Quarters.

3065.name: Airship Parking
description: This large, open area is the Westbridge Courier Office's parking lot.
The ground is coated with oil stains and a few broken-down airships sit
in corners of the lot, dragged away and awaiting towing.  A small
building is in the eastern part of the lot, a set of stairs leading up
into it.  A sign on the building reads, "{RWestbridge Courier{x"
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3108.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: Main Street continues here beside the lovely park in Westbridge.
Several people walk along the lush green grass of the park.  Birds
chirp, the trees are full, and the grass is very green.  Various
wildlife wanders the park including ducks and squirrels.  Main
street leads north and south.
| {WBanking here on Waterdeep is simple! Here are some     {b|
| {Wuseful commands to know:                               {b|
| {GDEPOSIT {g<{camount{g>  {g- {wwill deposit the amount and the    {b|
|  {Wtype of coin specified (example: deposit 1 silver)    {b|
| {GWITHDRAW {g<{camount{g> {g- {wwithdraws the specified amount     {b|
|  {Wfrom your account and appears on you.                 {b|
| {GBALANCE           {g- {wshows you your current balance     {b|
| {YHELPFUL BANKING TIPS:                                  {b|

| {Wlots of coins on Waterdeep, which will contribute to   {b|
| {Wyour overall weight. Take advantage of banks and       {b|
| {Wdeposit your extra money every now and then--there is  {b|
| {WNO penalty for using them!                             {b|
| {WIf you find you have a lot of gold or silver on you,   {b|
| {Wsimply give 1 <coin> self to have it converted!        {b|

2815.name: First National Bank Of Westbridge
description: Welcome to the First National Bank of the Tri-Power State.  To either
side of the room, the walls are lined with guards armed to the teeth.
There are several tellers behind a large wall, protected by iron bars.
The Bank was once powered by Westbridge itself, but now rules under the
government.  Tables line the walls for people to write on.  There are
exits to the west and east.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3102.name: {BThe {RPr{romena{Rde{B of {CMai{cn Street{x
description: The Promenade marks where Main Street meets River Street.  The river
can be heard flowing gently north of this street which runs alongside
it.  A large stone bridge crosses the river to the north toward Crier
Square.  River Street leads east, to the Westbridge Pawn Shop and
Kate's Diner, and west to the Stables.
You see the Cityguard Head Quarters.
Although a bit dusty the Coat of Arms is an excellent piece of work.

3142.name: Captain's Office
description: This is the Office of the Captain of the Guard, stationed right
beside the jail.  The Westbridge Coat of Arms is hanging on the
north wall and a heavy steel door is set in the west wall.  There
are almost always several cityguards here and they don't care for
intrusions.

3064.name: Westbridge Courier Check Point
description: This vast, hangar-like building is the Westbridge Courier Offices
checkpoint.  To the north, airships and people alike can pass through
to Westbridge Way.  To the south is parking for airships and the offices
proper.
You see Westbridge Way.
The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.
Break - You break it, you bought it.

3011.name: Gord's Weapons Palace
description: This is the inside the Gord's Weapon Palace. The walls are covered from
top to bottom with weapons of all kinds.  Gord stands here, smiling, waiting
for customers to buy something or to break something.
You see the Street.
It is a rather large fireplace made from heavy granite rocks.
The wooden sign says :-
Use 'list' to see what is in store,
'buy <item>' to buy an item,
'sell <item>' to sell an item and
'value <item>' to make the leather worker evaluate an item.
A lush tall green plant is here, growing in the sunshine.
It is made from solid oak but appears to be very used.  Its surface is
covered in marks and scratches.  A large burning candle stands directly on
the table surface, tallow flowing down its sides.

3035.name: Acid's Leather {!& Head{0 Shop
description: An acrid smell fills this large room.  Along the walls are numerous
shelves containing all sorts of animal hide and in the crackling fireplace
hangs a big iron pot with boiling water.  In the middle of the room is a
large oak table.
A wooden sign is hanging above the fireplace.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 100 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3001.name: The Temple of Life
description: This is the interior of a large white marble temple.  A pipe organ
plays in the background as people sing a hymn of peacefulness.  A
priest up front tells the story of the forces of the realms, be it Life,
the force that gives breath and a heartbeat, and Death, the force that
steals these gifts away.  There is a guard standing watch, keeping the
peace.  To the south is the Temple Square and to the west is the donation
room.  To the east is the {RCity Morgue{x and a newer section of Main Street
heads off to the north.

2908.name: Western gatehouse
description: This is a small room built into the city wall.  A mechanism for
lowering the siege door for the west gate is set into the wall, but
seems to be rust locked from years of neglect.  A small staircase
leads up to the top of the gatehouse.  Arsenal Street is to the east.

3036.name: {YP{*hil's {RB{rar{x
description: A small bar has been built under Crier Square, for the airship
pilots to sit and relax in.  Within a small and quiet bar stands, with
nice paintings on the wall and mainly clean.  Phil the bartender is
behind his bar cleaning glasses, and a few fellow pilots sit at the
bar.  A large jukebox sits to one corner, and a pool table with a
light in the other.

3220.name: Entrance to the Monk's Guild
description: Only a gate separates this training yard from the Street of Life
to the north.  To the south is a small building that looks only
large enough to house a stairwell that leads down.  This yard
is littered with splinters from spent staves as well as the
remains of many a straw man rent asunder.
You see the concourse.
The fresh young leaves of the elm tree wave gently in the wind.

3124.name: Elm Street
description: You near the end of Elm Street.  An old elm tree grows here.
The concourse joins Elm Street to the east, and the
street ends to the north near a run-down neighborhood.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 104 Main Street, Westbridge
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 105 Main Street, Westbridge

3315.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: Here is Main Street of Westbridge between Temple Square and Market
Square.  Gas lamp lights line both sides of the street.  Market Square
is further to the south, and the Temple to the north.  The {CCleric's Guild{x
is located west and the {CDruid's Guild{x is located to the east.

2911.name: Atop the western wall
description: This is a walkway atop the western wall of Westbridge.  A forest
extends to the west, and a small castle is barely visible above the
treetops.  To the north, an archway leads into one of the city
watchtowers.  To the south is the top of the western gatehouse.

3085.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{colding {CC{cell{*]{x
description: The walls are made of bricks: solid, cold and dry.  A window barred
with iron looks out to the east over the lawlessness of the dangerous
neighborhood beyond.  A small cot chained to the southern wall provides
a place to sit, otherwise there is little of interest in this room.
From the holding cell prisoners are sent to the local jail, and from
the jail they are sent to the prison.
You see Arsenel Street, Westbridge.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.

2824.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: You are on River Street.  To the south, on the other side of a low
fence, is the park and all its lush, green vegetation.  To the north,
the river of Westbridge flows east and west alongside River Street.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.

3251.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: The Street of Death ends into Coffin Street here beside the eastern
wall of Westbridge.  To the west can be found several shops and other
buildings.  Somewhere to the south there is the sound of water.

2825.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: This is the eastern end of River Street.  Coffin Street lies just to
the east where it runs alongside the eastern wall of the city.  To
the north are some old shop buildings, now shuttered, while to the south
are dilapidated buildings and several vacant lots that are littered in
trash.  This part of town seems to have been neglected and could use
some renovation.
The sign reads:
Use 'List' to see the available pets.
Use 'Buy <pet> <name>' to buy yourself a pet and name it.
You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around.
If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master.
If you have several pets you may use 'order all <instructions>'
Regards,
The Shopkeeper

3031.name: Pet Shop Boy's Pet Shop
description: The Pet Shop is a small crowded store, full of cages and animals of
various sorts and sizes.  There is a sign on the wall.
You see a small donation room.
You see the temple square.

3365.name: Temple Of Death
description: You stand in a large black marble temple.  You hear strange music
coming from the altar, it sounds like a guitar but..  Almost
electrical.  Some Demons stand on the altar yelling out strange
chants.  You hear the priest up front tell the story of the forces of
the realms, being it Life, the force that gives you breath, a
heartbeat.  And Death, the force that steals these gifts away.  You
see a guard here keeping the peace.  To the south is the Temple
Square.  And to the west is the donation room.  To the east is the
{RCity Morgue{x and to the north is the {CWaterdeep Gardens{x.

2879.name: The Southern End Of The Wreckage

2864.name: The Hall of {CG{cl{Co{cr{Cy{x
description: This is the grand Hall of Glory, the final passage on the way to the
Hall of Judgement.  The hallway is lined with tapestries depicting the
great victories of the Pax Faerunis against the darkness of the realms.
The aura of this hallway is breath taking, radiating with the goodness
and light that makes up all those who are in the Pax and all the powerful
warriors who call themselves Paxians.  A large engraving of a harp is
carved high up on the ceiling.  The seal of the Harpers is here, keeping
the balance of the world.

3017.name: Entrance to Mage's Guild
description: The entrance hall is a small, poor lighted room.  A narrow flight
of stairs leads down into the bar, where pipe smoke fills the air.

2893.name: Under the West Gate of Westbridge
description: Here, the road leads between two small towers that have been built
into the city wall, connected with a footbridge across the heavy
wooden gate.  Westbridge Way leads east all the way through the town.
To the west, the edge of a big forest can be seen.
You see a sign saying 'KEEP OUT'.

3110.name: Cityguard Headquarters
description: This is a tidy office within the Cityguard Headquarters.  A big
desk made from dark wood is standing in the centre of the room.
Cityguards come and go with regularity.
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see South Street, Westbridge

2838.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: South Street marks the southernmost edge of Westbridge.  The south
wall looms high overhead, helping to keep the city safe from invaders.
The street continues on to the west and east.
You can see the northeast corner of the city wall.

3265.name: Tunnel Under Main Street
description: A dimly lit tunnel runs under Main Street and the Temple of
Life.  A bright light can be seen in the distance to the north
and there is a set of stairs leading up to the surface.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2819.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: Main Street continues running north and south through the city. Here,
there is a mix of feelings.  On the west side side of the street there
is a bright, almost cheery disposition centering around a large meeting
hall with a sign that reads {RThe PaX Hall{x.  On the eastern side of the
street, it is almost as dark as night, with deep shadows looming about
the {YTemple of Shar{x.

3391.name: Crudely dug Tunnel
description: You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2843.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street runs alongside the recently developed neighborhoods
of Westbridge.  Many large trees grow beside the road, along with well
manicured bushes and trimmed grass.  The street leads north and south.
You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.

3376.name: Vampire's Crypt
description: This crypt is filled wall-to-wall with coffins, some open, some tossed
haphazardly against the wall, some perfectly undisturbed.  It's so dark
here even elves would have trouble seeing clearly.  A well in the middle
of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the depths.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 604 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3024.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: This is the Street Of Death, just west of Main Street.  Melancholy's
map shop is to the north.  The street continues further west and east,
where Festival Square can be found.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

2817.name: {W[ {CWe{cstbridge {RC{rity {GP{glaza {W]{x
description: Main Street and Judge Street meet to form Westbridge City Plaza.
This newer area has been converted from what was once an extension
of the park of Westbridge.  City Plaza is a large square.  In the
center, a fountain pours forth clean, cool water.  Some park benches
sit on the side of the plaza.  Main Street continues north and south.
Judge Street goes east and west.
To the south, Selduth Street intersects with a crowded Clan street.

3259.name: Selduth Street
description: You are walking along Selduth Street, which extends along the inside of the western
wall of Westbridge.  To the south, you can see an intersection with a crowded
Clan street.  The northwestern corner of the city wall lies ahead to the
north.
| {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|
|               {wbut only if the shopkeeper deals in      {b|
|               {wthat kind of item.                       {b|
| {GVALUE {g<{citem{g> {g- {wthe shopkeeper will offer you a price   {b|
|                {wfor your item, if he is interested at   {b|
|                {wall.                                    {b|
| {YHELPFUL BUYING TIP:                                    {b|
| {WHaving problems selling an item? Try selling it in a   {b|
| {Wshop that specializes in the type of item. For example,{b|
| {Wsell a sword to an armorer or weaponsmith, or find a   {b|
| {Wpawn shop, which will buy just about anything!         {b|

3020.name: Armoury
description: The armoury with all kinds of armours on the walls and in the window.
There are helmets, shields and chain mails.  To the north is Westbridge
Way.  On the wall is a small sign.

3371.name: Entrance to Ranger's Guild
description: This room has a feral smell to it, as if it were once a stable
of some sort.  A rack of spears of various lengths and designs
adorns the western wall.  An exit leads south to the street.  A
small trapdoor is set into the floor.

2862.name: {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{&un{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{B [Station]{x
description: This is the inside of a small building.  All around is a large room
with a few scattered tables.  A large counter sits to the left.  To
the unobservant this may appear to be a bar, yet it is a special place.
The crowd within don't bother to look at newcomers, they simply continue
their quiet conversations with their customers, sitting at the tables.
This is the store known as {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{Wun{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{x.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2847.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: This is Arsenal Street, which runs north and south through
Westbridge.  To the east is the entrance to Westbrigde Park.
It is a relaxing spot of natural beauty in the midst of all
the surrounding buildings.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.

2823.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: River Street runs east and west, following the river that cuts
through the city just north of here.  The back part of some stables
can be seen on the north side whereas on the south side of the street
a low fence blocks off the lush city park.

3061.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x
description: Coffin Street continues north and south along the eastern city wall.
To the east, in the shadow of the towering wall, is the very courtroom-
like {YTemple of Tyr{x.

2929.name: Top of the southwest tower
description: A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the west, the green
canopy of the Haon Dor forest stretches off into the distance.  To
the south, a city is barely visible beyond the Miden'nir forest.
Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
You see the southern end of the temple of Death.

3366.name: In A Place Of Lava
description: Your eyes open and the pain of your last battle hits you. You have been killed
and now are resting in a plane not of that of the area surrounding Westbridge.
You are in an underground cave that is lighted by lava and brimstone. The
smell of sulfur is strong. You see in the distances mortals chained together
dragging a bolder across the hot floor. A human with hoofed feet and a tail
and a whip attacks the slaves dragging the boulder.

2914.name: In the northeast tower
description: This is a small circular room within the northeast tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the west and south.

2925.name: Western gatehouse
description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the north, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the south.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge.

2836.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x
description: The southernmost street of Westbridge, South Street, intersects
with Emerald Avenue here.  South Street runs west and east and
Emerald Avenue leads north.  To the west is the South Gate where
travelers enter and exit the city.

3112.name: Western Park Entrance
description: This is the western end of the Westbridge park.  A small, tree
lined path winds its way lazily around the park and west, out onto
Arsenal Street.  To the east is the edge of a small pond.

3081.name: Waterdeep North
description: {x
Welcome to Waterdeep, the city seems to be missing at the moment, please try back later.
{x
Now leaving Waterdeep, thank you for coming, please come back again.
{x
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2846.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Arsenal Street runs north and south between the neighborhoods of
Westbridge to the west and the park to the east.  Large trees in
the park provide shade for the street and bushes grow over the low
fence surrounding the park.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 108 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3105.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: This is Main Street in Westbridge.  On the western side of the street,
lush grass, green bushes, and large trees can be found in the Park of
Westbridge.  Main Street continues north and south.
A small door to the south leads out into the map shop.
This chest is firmly locked, and the device by which it opens is beyond your
reckoning.

3161.name: Melancholy's Room
description: A faint smell of incense lingers in the air within this room.  A soft
bearskin rug lays upon the floor, muffling footsteps.  A simple bed lies
against the far wall.  At the foot of it is a sturdy ironbound chest, most
likely full of Melancholy's trappings from her adventuring days.  On a small
table under a window to the east is a vase with a single white rose.  Other
than that, the room is quite bare.

3048.name: PIT
description: Welcome to The PIT, the lowest and cheapest place to drink.  The
bar's walls are totaly empty because every picture that was hung here
has been smashed over someone's head.  A sign on the wall reads 'Nightly
Fights'.  Fortunately there are some tables and stools left for sitting.

3063.name: Westbridge Beacon Courier
description: A small room opens up here.  A large counter stretches across the
room leaving very little room to stand in.  Behind the counter are
several rows of shelves, with large crates on top.  A few workers walk
back and forth with clipboards checking the stock, as a very fat guy
sits at the counter looking not so busy.

3221.name: Small Stairwell House
description: The small doorway opens to a stairwell that leads down into
a much cooler room.  The faint scent of incense wafts on the
air, bringing with it an aura of complete and utter peace
and calm.  The stone steps radiate their own coolness, and
the center of each stair shows a well-worn path down into
the depths.

3141.name: End of Penny Lane
description: Penny Lane dead ends here in a small, circular cul-de-sac.  There
is a large fountain in the middle of the circle.  A variety of quaint
little houses line the secluded street.
You see the Outside of Westbridge.
You see Street of Life.

3262.name: Tunnel Under the Temple of Life
description: This small, dimly lit tunnel runs under Main Street and the
Temple of Life.  A bright light can be seen coming from the
north and the thick cement foundation of the Temple of Life
looms overhead.

3139.name: Penny Lane
description: Penny Lane is a quiet, tree-lined street.  The lane is narrow and
does not appear to see much traffic.  Emerald Avenue can be found
to the west and Penny Lane continues around a bend to the north.
You see the House of Fetish.
The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.

3381.name: Mercy's Counter
description: There is a long counter set against the gray, dungeon like wall
of the room.  Mercy can normally be found behind the counter, ready
to sell her customers whatever they desire.  There is a small note
on the counter.

3094.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x
description: A tunnel large enough for an airship turns east to a pair of large
doors, on the doors written into the wood is "WESTBRIDGE CARGO
COURIER, Blow Horn For Entrance".

2887.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x
description: Alongside the western wall of the city, Arsenal Street runs
north and south, marking the western edge of Westbridge.  To
the east is the turbulent {YTemple of Talos{x.
{b|                          {RP{Yaid {RA{Ydventures!                          {b|
| {cTo open a run at random, say "{Copen random run{c".  This will attempt {b|
| {cto open a currently closed run at random.  You will only be charged{b|
| {cthe 15 AP if a run is successfully opened in this way.  Note that  {b|
| {csometimes it can fail.                                             {b|
| {cTo open a specific run, say "{Copen <run name>{c".  For a run that is  {b|
| {ccurrently closed, this service costs 30 AP.  To open a run that has{b|
| {cbeen completed costs 300.  There is no warning in the costs, you   {b|
| {cwill simply be charged the correct amount.  No refunds will be     {b|
| {cgiven for not following directions.                                {b|
| {cthe run names for this service are as follows.                     {b|
| {Cmoonshae, hellfire, deeper, iwd, kelvin, blackstaff, ckc, despair  {b|
| {Cteilmon, tchazzar, good and evil.                                  {b|
| {cTo see a list of the "Mini Runs" that do not show on the claim     {b|
| {clist that are open, say "{Cavailable events{c".  If none are open      {b|
| {cLoxar will not respond.                                            {b|

3224.name: {RA{Ydventures {RU{Ynlimited{x
description: This room is full of grisly trophies of various sorts of monsters.  A large
dragon head with maw open exends from the wall above a large wooden counter
set in the west end of the shop.  Paintings and tapestries depicting the
killings of many infamous monsters.  A grizzled old warrior bristling with
weapons rests with his feet up behind the counter.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'

3043.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x
description: Arsenal Street, running north and south along the western wall,
meets with the Street of Death, leading off to the east.  To the
west are the imposing columns of the Temple of Fear.  Some letters
have been written on the wall here.

2921.name: Atop the southern wall
description: A walkway leads atop the southern wall of Westbridge.  Down below,
a road extends to the south through a dark forest.  Archways to the
east and west lead into city watchtowers.
You see the House of Fetish.

3379.name: Nemesis' Private Dungeon
description: This hidden grotto is Nemesis' private chamber.  One must be careful
not to let her catch them here, or they may never want to leave.  Leather
straps hang down from the walls, some of which are still occupied.
There is a huge canopied waterbed with mirrors set into the ceiling
overhead.  The bed has black satin sheets and five or six huge feather
pillows.  Leather restraints fall down off the four corners of the bed.

3125.name: Westbridge City Hall
description: Construction is in progress for a Westbridge City Hall.  There
is scaffolding against the walls and workers regularly come and
go with various building materials.

2906.name: Base of the Northeast Tower
description: At the base of the tower is this small circular room.  Spiral stairs
lead further up into the watchtower.  A recently renovated entranceway
in the north wall leads to {RThe Westbridge Train Station{x.  What looks
to have once been a doorway in the south wall has been bricked shut.
You see the study.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.

3372.name: Ranger's Bar
description: This is a rustic-looking tavern, decorated liberally with stuffed bears,
wildcats, and various other vicious fauna.  The chairs here are crafted
from antlers and animal bone, and behind a massive bar made of roughly-
hewn oak stands a very tough looking bartender.  A small sign is hanging
on the wall.

3083.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron {g[{C319 {RC{ro{*ff{ri{Rn {GS{gt.{g]{x
description: A set of cold marble steps lead up to the small station house nestled
here in the south central part of Westbridge.  Behind the station
house, to the east is the dangerous neighborhood of Westbridge, home to
roaming gangs, outlaws and lawlessness.  Two large black doors lead
east into the station house of the Order of Judgment.  The globes on
the lights next to the door read "Police".

2889.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x
description: The Main Street of Westbridge runs north and south through town.  Gas
lamp lights line the street on either side.  To the west, a large window
looks in on the {RMarket Square Coffee Cafe{..  Some tables sit outside the
cafe.  The {RMarket Square Pub {xis to the east.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

3104.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: You are on Coffin Street.  To the east, the city wall opens up to
White Dragon Boulevard and the bad neighborhoods of Westbridge.  It
is a feared place with gangs and crime.  River Street leads off to
the west.

3388.name: West trail around Westbridge
description: You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and south along the wall.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.

2844.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x
description: Judge Street ends here at Arsenal Street beside the neighborhoods
of Westbridge.  Judge leads off to the east, heading toward a cafe
and Westbridge City Plaza beyond.  The park lies to the north along
Arsenal Street, which also continues to the south.
You see Penny Lane.
The concourse continues south, towards an intersection with Elm Street.

3272.name: On the Concourse at Penny Lane
description: You are on a road leading around the inner walls of Westbridge.  To the north,
the concourse heads towards a bridge into northern Westbridge.  To the south,
you can see an intersection with Elm Street.  The quaint paved streets of
Penny Lane lie west.
The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.

3357.name: [E] Bar
description: A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub.  Mugs line a shelf
behind the bar.  Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids decorate one
of the lower shelves.  A large cask rests on a table behind the bar.  A
strong but friendly-looking bartender stands next to the cask polishing
glasses.  A couple of the bar maids stand in a corner and throw the most
inviting glances your way. An open balcony looks out over the bustling
Market Square.

2849.name: Market Square Coffee Cafe
description: The smell of coffee fills this cozy establishment.  The Cafe is
small and quiet.  Round tables stand scattered around the main floor.
The walls are brick, featuring rows of book shelves filled with books.
To the west, a large bar stands, with several coffee makers behind it.
A spiraling staircase leads up to the roof.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 704 Ocean Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.

3101.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x
description: River Street follows the river, which runs through Westbridge just
north of here.  The cool bubbling waters sound from between the
buildings.  To the south is a bright area in the park.  To the north
sits the {RStables of Westbridge{x, while River Street continues west into
the neighborhoods of the city.
It looks like some kind of office.

3137.name: Waiting Room
description: You are standing in the chard remains of the town hall. Burnt wooden chairs
still line the walls and a large burnt desk still sits in the middle of the
room.

2907.name: Base of the northwest tower
description: This is a small circular room in the base of the northwest tower.
A set of spiral stairs lead further up into the tower.  There is a
heavy iron door set into the north wall.  It looks like there used
to be a door in the south wall but it has since been bricked up.
